Function of the Adrenal Medullae

Epinephrine and norepinephrine are released when the adrenal medullae is stimulated. These transmitters almost have the same effects throughout the body as direct sympathetic stimulation. Moreover, their effects are greatly prolonged, lasting 2-4 minutes after the stimulation is over.

Importance of the Adrenal Medullae to the Function of the SNS

  1. Direct stimulation by the sympathetic nerves, and indirect stimulation by adrenal medullary hormones provide a safety factor since one mechanism substitute for the other if it is missing.
  2. Epinephrine and norepinephrine can stimulate structures of the body that are not innervated by direct sympathetic fibers.
